page.title: 10Warmington Village #2
page.content: The Green is the scene of the annual Fete held at the end of July,being one of the largest village events in the area.This primary fundraising even is for the upkeep of Village common land/ property and donations to charities. Noteworthy properties in the Village:- {1.The Plough Public House {2.The Village Primary school}closed in 1970 but now an active PLAYGROUP which brings in children from 12 neighbouring villages.Juniors now go to school in Fenny Compton or Farnborough. {3.The Parish Church}(atop the famous Warmington Hill,on the 600ft contour), lying to the South of the village,with splendid views across the village and valley.Built of Marlstone from the nearby Towerpits quarry.This is still an outstanding landmark for the Village.
